description: Whoever causes hurt on grave and sudden provocation shall be punished with imprisonment up to one month, or with fine up to ₹500, or with both.

title: Voluntarily causing grievous hurt on provocation
description: Whoever causes grievous hurt on grave and sudden provocation shall be punished with imprisonment up to four years, or with fine up to ₹2,000, or with both.

title: Act endangering life or personal safety of others
description: Whoever does an act so rashly as to endanger human life shall be punished with imprisonment up to three months, or with fine up to ₹250, or with both.

title: Causing hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others
description: Whoever causes hurt by a rash act shall be punished with imprisonment up to six months, or with fine up to ₹500, or with both.

title: Causing grievous hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others
description: Whoever causes grievous hurt by a rash act shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine up to ₹1,000, or with both.

title: Wrongful restraint
description: Whoever voluntarily obstructs a person from proceeding in any direction shall be punished with imprisonment up to one month, or with fine up to ₹500, or with both.

title: Wrongful confinement
description: Whoever wrongfully restrains a person in such a way as to prevent him from moving beyond certain limits shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine up to ₹1,000, or with both.

title: Punishment for wrongful restraint
description: Whoever wrongfully restrains any person shall be punished with imprisonment up to one month, or with fine up to ₹500, or with both.

title: Punishment for wrongful confinement
description: Whoever wrongfully confines any person shall be punished with imprisonment up to one year, or with fine up to ₹1,000, or with both.

title: Wrongful confinement for three or more days
description: Whoever wrongfully confines a person for three or more days shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Wrongful confinement for ten or more days
description: Whoever wrongfully confines a person for ten or more days shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Wrongful confinement of person for whose liberation writ has been issued
description: Whoever wrongfully confines a person after a writ for their release has been issued shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, in addition to any other punishment.

title: Wrongful confinement in secret
description: Whoever wrongfully confines a person in secret shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, in addition to any other punishment.

title: Wrongful confinement to extort property or constrain to illegal act
description: Whoever wrongfully confines a person to extort property shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Wrongful confinement to extort confession or compel restoration of property
description: Whoever wrongfully confines a person to extort a confession shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Force
description: A person is said to use force if they cause motion, change of motion, or cessation of motion to another person or object.

title: Criminal force
description: Whoever intentionally uses force to commit an offence, or to cause injury, fear, or annoyance, uses criminal force.

title: Assault
description: Whoever makes any gesture or preparation intending or knowing it to be likely that such gesture will cause apprehension of criminal force commits assault.

title: Punishment for assault or criminal force otherwise than on grave provocation
description: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force shall be punished with imprisonment up to three months, or with fine up to ₹500, or with both.

title: Assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharge of his duty
description: Whoever assaults a public servant to deter him from duty shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Assault or criminal force to woman with intent to outrage her modesty
description: Whoever assaults a woman to outrage her modesty shall be punished with imprisonment up to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Sexual harassment and punishment for sexual harassment
description: Whoever commits sexual harassment shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Assault or use of criminal force to woman with intent to disrobe
description: Whoever assaults a woman with intent to disrobe her shall be punished with imprisonment from three to seven years.

title: Voyeurism
description: Whoever watches or captures a woman’s private acts without consent shall be punished with imprisonment from one to three years.

title: Stalking
description: Whoever follows or contacts a woman persistently shall be punished with imprisonment up to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Assault or criminal force with intent to dishonour person, otherwise than on grave provocation
description: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force intending to dishonor a person (except under grave provocation) shall be punished with imprisonment up to 2 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Assault or criminal force in attempt to commit theft of property carried by a person
description: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force while attempting to commit theft of property carried by a person shall be punished with imprisonment up to 2 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Assault or criminal force in attempt wrongfully to confine a person
description: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force in an attempt to wrongfully confine a person shall be punished with imprisonment up to 1 year, or with fine up to ₹1,000, or both.

title: Assault or criminal force on grave and sudden provocation
description: Whoever assaults or uses criminal force under grave and sudden provocation shall be punished with imprisonment up to 1 month, or with fine up to ₹200, or both.

title: Kidnapping
description: Kidnapping is of two kinds: (1) kidnapping from India, and (2) kidnapping from lawful guardianship.

title: Kidnapping from India
description: Whoever conveys any person beyond the limits of India without their consent or the consent of someone legally authorized is guilty of kidnapping from India.

title: Kidnapping from lawful guardianship
description: Whoever takes or entices a minor (under 16 for males, under 18 for females) or a person of unsound mind from their lawful guardian without consent commits kidnapping.

title: Abduction
description: Whoever by force compels or deceitfully induces any person to go from any place is said to abduct that person.

title: Punishment for kidnapping
description: Whoever kidnaps any person shall be punished with imprisonment up to 7 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Kidnapping or maiming a minor for purposes of begging
description: Whoever kidnaps or maims a minor to use them for begging shall be punished with imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Kidnapping or abducting in order to murder
description: Whoever kidnaps or abducts a person with intent to murder shall be punished with imprisonment for life or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Kidnapping for ransom, etc.
description: Whoever kidnaps a person and threatens to kill or harm them to extort ransom shall be punished with death or imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Kidnapping or abducting with intent secretly and wrongfully to confine person
description: Whoever kidnaps or abducts a person to secretly confine them shall be punished with imprisonment up to 7 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Kidnapping, abducting or inducing woman to compel her marriage, etc.
description: Whoever kidnaps or abducts a woman to force her into marriage or illicit intercourse shall be punished with imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Procuration of minor girl
description: Whoever induces a minor girl (under 18) to go from any place for illicit intercourse shall be punished with imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Importation of girl from foreign country
description: Whoever imports a girl under 21 from a foreign country for illicit intercourse shall be punished with imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Kidnapping or abducting in order to subject person to grievous hurt, slavery, etc.
description: Whoever kidnaps or abducts a person to subject them to grievous hurt, slavery, etc., shall be punished with imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Wrongfully concealing or keeping in confinement, kidnapped or abducted person
description: Whoever knowingly conceals a kidnapped or abducted person shall be punished in the same manner as the kidnapper.

title: Kidnapping or abducting child under ten years with intent to steal from its person
description: Whoever kidnaps a child under 10 to steal from them shall be punished with imprisonment up to 7 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Buying or disposing of any person as a slave
description: Whoever buys, sells, or deals in slaves shall be punished with imprisonment up to 7 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Exploitation of a trafficked person
description: Whoever exploits a trafficked person shall be punished with imprisonment from 3 to 5 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Habitual dealing in slaves
description: Whoever habitually deals in slaves shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Selling minor for purposes of prostitution, etc.
description: Whoever sells a minor (under 18) for prostitution or illicit intercourse shall be punished with imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Buying minor for purposes of prostitution, etc.
description: Whoever buys a minor (under 18) for prostitution or illicit intercourse shall be punished with imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Unlawful compulsory labour
description: Whoever unlawfully compels any person to labour shall be punished with imprisonment up to 1 year, or with fine, or both.

title: Rape
description: A man commits rape if he has sexual intercourse with a woman against her will, without consent, or with consent obtained under fear, fraud, or misconception.

title: Punishment for rape
description: Whoever commits rape shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment not less than 10 years (extendable to life), and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for causing death or resulting in persistent vegetative state of victim
description: If rape results in death or persistent vegetative state, the offender shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment from 20 years to life or death.

title: Punishment for rape on woman under twelve years of age
description: Whoever rapes a girl under 12 shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment from 20 years to life, and shall also be liable to fine or death.

title: Sexual intercourse by husband upon his wife during separation
description: If a husband has sexual intercourse with his separated wife without consent, he shall be punished with imprisonment from 2 to 7 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Sexual intercourse by a person in authority
description: Whoever in a position of authority (e.g., public servant, jailer) induces a woman into sexual intercourse shall be punished with imprisonment from 5 to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Gang rape
description: Where a woman is raped by one or more persons acting in furtherance of a common intention, each shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment from 20 years to life.

title: Punishment for gang rape on woman under sixteen years of age
description: Gang rape of a girl under 16 shall be punished with imprisonment for life, and each offender shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for gang rape on woman under twelve years of age
description: Gang rape of a girl under 12 shall be punished with death or life imprisonment, and each offender shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for repeat offenders
description: Whoever is convicted again for rape shall be punished with life imprisonment or death.

title: Unnatural offences
description: Whoever voluntarily has carnal intercourse against the order of nature shall be punished with imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Theft
description: Whoever dishonestly takes movable property out of another’s possession without consent commits theft.

title: Punishment for theft
description: Whoever commits theft shall be punished with imprisonment up to 3 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Theft in dwelling house, etc.
description: Whoever commits theft in a building, tent, or vessel used as a dwelling shall be punished with imprisonment up to 7 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Theft by clerk or servant of property in possession of master
description: If a clerk or servant commits theft of property in their master’s possession, they shall be punished with imprisonment up to 7 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Theft after preparation made for causing death, hurt, or restraint
description: Whoever commits theft having made preparations to cause death, hurt, or restraint shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Extortion
description: Whoever intentionally puts a person in fear of injury and dishonestly induces them to deliver property commits extortion.

title: Punishment for extortion
description: Whoever commits extortion shall be punished with imprisonment up to 3 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Putting person in fear of injury in order to commit extortion
description: Whoever puts a person in fear of injury to commit extortion shall be punished with imprisonment up to 2 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Extortion by putting a person in fear of death or grievous hurt
description: Whoever commits extortion by putting a person in fear of death or grievous hurt shall be punished with imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Putting person in fear of death or grievous hurt in order to commit extortion
description: Whoever puts a person in fear of death or grievous hurt to commit extortion shall be punished with imprisonment up to 7 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Extortion by threat of accusation of an offence punishable with death or imprisonment for life
description: Whoever commits extortion by threatening to accuse a person of a capital offence shall be punished with imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Putting person in fear of accusation of offence, in order to commit extortion
description: Whoever puts a person in fear of accusation of a capital offence to commit extortion shall be punished with imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Robbery
description: Theft or extortion becomes robbery if violence or fear of violence is used during the act.

title: Dacoity
description: When five or more persons commit or attempt to commit robbery, it is dacoity.

title: Punishment for robbery
description: Whoever commits robbery shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Attempt to commit robbery
description: Whoever attempts to commit robbery shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment up to 7 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Voluntarily causing hurt in committing robbery
description: If hurt is caused in committing robbery, the offender shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for dacoity
description: Whoever commits dacoity shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Dacoity with murder
description: If any dacoit commits murder during dacoity, all members shall be punished with death or imprisonment for life, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Robbery or dacoity, with attempt to cause death or grievous hurt
description: If, during robbery or dacoity, the offender uses deadly weapons or attempts to cause grievous hurt, they shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment for at least 7 years.

title: Attempt to commit robbery or dacoity when armed with deadly weapon
description: Whoever, when armed with a deadly weapon, attempts to commit robbery or dacoity shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years.

title: Making preparation to commit dacoity
description: Whoever makes preparation to commit dacoity shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for belonging to gang of dacoits
description: Whoever belongs to a gang of dacoits shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for belonging to gang of thieves
description: Whoever belongs to a gang of thieves shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment up to 7 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Assembling for purpose of committing dacoity
description: Whoever assembles with others for the purpose of committing dacoity shall be punished with rigorous imprisonment up to 7 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Dishonest misappropriation of property
description: Whoever dishonestly misappropriates movable property shall be punished with imprisonment up to 2 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Dishonest misappropriation of property possessed by deceased person at the time of his death
description: Whoever misappropriates property of a deceased person shall be punished with imprisonment up to 3 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Criminal breach of trust
description: Whoever, being entrusted with property, dishonestly misappropriates it, commits criminal breach of trust.

title: Punishment for criminal breach of trust
description: Whoever commits criminal breach of trust shall be punished with imprisonment up to 3 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Criminal breach of trust by carrier, etc.
description: Whoever, being a carrier, wharfinger, or warehouse-keeper, commits criminal breach of trust shall be punished with imprisonment up to 7 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Criminal breach of trust by clerk or servant
description: Whoever, being a clerk or servant, commits criminal breach of trust shall be punished with imprisonment up to 7 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Criminal breach of trust by public servant, or by banker, merchant, or agent
description: Whoever, being a public servant or in a position of trust, commits criminal breach of trust shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Stolen property
description: Property obtained by theft, extortion, robbery, dacoity, or criminal misappropriation is considered stolen property.

title: Dishonestly receiving stolen property
description: Whoever dishonestly receives or retains stolen property shall be punished with imprisonment up to 3 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Dishonestly receiving property stolen in the commission of a dacoity
description: Whoever dishonestly receives property stolen in dacoity shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Habitually dealing in stolen property
description: Whoever habitually deals in stolen property shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Assisting in concealment of stolen property
description: Whoever assists in concealing stolen property shall be punished with imprisonment up to 3 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Cheating
description: Whoever deceives another person to fraudulently induce them to deliver property or consent to retention of property commits cheating.

title: Cheating by personation
description: Whoever cheats by pretending to be another person commits cheating by personation.

title: Punishment for cheating
description: Whoever cheats shall be punished with imprisonment up to 1 year, or with fine, or both.

title: Cheating with knowledge that wrongful loss may ensue to person whose interest offender is bound to protect
description: Whoever cheats knowing that wrongful loss may be caused to a person whose interest they are bound to protect shall be punished with imprisonment up to 3 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Punishment for cheating by personation
description: Whoever cheats by personation shall be punished with imprisonment up to 3 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Cheating and dishonestly inducing delivery of property
description: Whoever cheats and thereby dishonestly induces the deceived person to deliver property shall be punished with imprisonment up to 7 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Dishonest or fraudulent removal or concealment of property to prevent distribution among creditors
description: Whoever dishonestly conceals property to prevent creditors from receiving it shall be punished with imprisonment up to 2 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Dishonestly or fraudulently preventing debt being available for creditors
description: Whoever dishonestly prevents a debt from being available for creditors shall be punished with imprisonment up to 2 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Dishonest or fraudulent execution of deed of transfer containing false statement of consideration
description: Whoever fraudulently executes a false deed shall be punished with imprisonment up to 2 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Dishonest or fraudulent removal or concealment of property
description: Whoever dishonestly conceals property to prevent rightful distribution shall be punished with imprisonment up to 2 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Mischief
description: Whoever intentionally causes wrongful loss or damage to the public or any person commits mischief.

title: Punishment for mischief
description: Whoever commits mischief shall be punished with imprisonment up to 3 months, or with fine, or both.

title: Mischief causing damage to the amount of fifty rupees
description: Whoever commits mischief causing damage of ₹50 or more shall be punished with imprisonment up to 2 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Mischief by killing or maiming animal of the value of ten rupees
description: Whoever kills or maims an animal worth ₹10 or more shall be punished with imprisonment up to 2 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Mischief by killing or maiming cattle, etc., of any value or any animal of the value of fifty rupees
description: Whoever kills or maims cattle or an animal worth ₹50 or more shall be punished with imprisonment up to 5 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Mischief by injury to works of irrigation or by wrongfully diverting water
description: Whoever causes mischief by diverting water or damaging irrigation works shall be punished with imprisonment up to 5 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Mischief by injury to public road, bridge, river or channel
description: Whoever causes mischief by damaging public roads, bridges, or rivers shall be punished with imprisonment up to 5 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Mischief by causing inundation or obstruction to public drainage attended with damage
description: Whoever causes flooding or obstructs drainage shall be punished with imprisonment up to 5 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Mischief by destroying, moving or rendering less useful a lighthouse or sea-mark
description: Whoever damages a lighthouse or sea-mark shall be punished with imprisonment up to 7 years, or with fine, or both.

title: Mischief by destroying or moving, etc., a landmark fixed by public authority
description: Whoever destroys a public landmark shall be punished with imprisonment up to 1 year, or with fine, or both.

title: Mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to cause damage to amount of one hundred or (in case of agricultural produce) ten rupees
description: Whoever commits mischief by fire causing damage of ₹100 or more (₹10 for crops) shall be punished with imprisonment up to 7 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to destroy house, etc.
description: Whoever commits mischief by fire intending to destroy a house shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Mischief with intent to destroy or make unsafe a decked vessel or one of twenty tons burden
description: Whoever commits mischief to endanger a vessel shall be punished with imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for the mischief described in Section 437 committed by fire or explosive substance
description: If mischief under Section 437 is committed by fire, the offender shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for intentionally running vessel aground or ashore with intent to commit theft, etc.
description: Whoever intentionally runs a vessel aground to commit theft shall be punished with imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Mischief committed after preparation made for causing death or hurt
description: Whoever commits mischief after preparing to cause death or hurt shall be punished with imprisonment up to 5 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Criminal trespass
description: Whoever enters or remains on another’s property unlawfully commits criminal trespass.

title: House-trespass
description: Whoever commits criminal trespass by entering a building, tent, or vessel used as a dwelling commits house-trespass.

title: Lurking house-trespass
description: Whoever commits house-trespass having taken precautions to conceal such trespass from some person who has a right to exclude or eject the trespasser, commits lurking house-trespass.

title: Lurking house-trespass by night
description: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass after sunset and before sunrise, commits lurking house-trespass by night.

title: House-breaking
description: A person is said to commit house-breaking who commits house-trespass if he enters or quits through a passage made by himself or any abettor, or through any passage not intended for human entrance.

title: House-breaking by night
description: Whoever commits house-breaking after sunset and before sunrise, commits house-breaking by night.

title: Punishment for criminal trespass
description: Whoever commits criminal trespass shall be punished with imprisonment up to 3 months, or with fine up to 500 rupees, or with both.

title: Punishment for house-trespass
description: Whoever commits house-trespass shall be punished with imprisonment up to 1 year, or with fine up to 1,000 rupees, or with both.

title: House-trespass to commit offense punishable with death
description: Whoever commits house-trespass to commit an offense punishable with death, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with rigorous imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: House-trespass to commit offense punishable with imprisonment for life
description: Whoever commits house-trespass to commit an offense punishable with imprisonment for life, shall be punished with imprisonment up to 10 years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: House-trespass to commit offence punishable with imprisonment
description: Whoever commits house-trespass in order to commit any offence punishable with imprisonment, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: House-trespass after preparation for hurt, assault or wrongful restraint
description: Whoever commits house-trespass, having made preparation for causing hurt to any person or for assaulting any person or for wrongfully restraining any person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for lurking house-trespass or house-breaking
description: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass or house-breaking, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking to commit offence punishable with imprisonment
description: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass or house-breaking in order to commit any offence punishable with imprisonment, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking after preparation for hurt, assault or wrongful restraint
description: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass or house-breaking, having made preparation for causing hurt to any person or for assaulting any person or for wrongfully restraining any person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Punishment for lurking house-trespass or house-breaking by night
description: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass by night or house-breaking by night, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking by night to commit offence punishable with imprisonment
description: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass by night or house-breaking by night in order to commit any offence punishable with imprisonment, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Lurking house-trespass or house-breaking by night after preparation for hurt, assault or wrongful restraint
description: Whoever commits lurking house-trespass by night or house-breaking by night, having made preparation for causing hurt to any person or for assaulting any person or for wrongfully restraining any person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to fourteen years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Grievous hurt caused whilst committing lurking house-trespass or house-breaking
description: Whoever, whilst committing lurking house-trespass or house-breaking, causes grievous hurt to any person or attempts to cause death or grievous hurt to any person, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: House-breaking or house-trespass by person jointly concerned in lurking house-trespass or house-breaking
description: Where two or more persons are jointly concerned in committing lurking house-trespass or house-breaking, each of them shall be deemed to have committed house-trespass or house-breaking.

title: Dishonestly breaking open receptacle containing property
description: Whoever dishonestly or with intent to commit mischief breaks open or unfastens any closed receptacle which contains or which he believes to contain property, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment for same offence when committed by person entrusted with custody
description: Whoever, being entrusted with any closed receptacle which contains or which he believes to contain property, without having authority to open the same, dishonestly or with intent to commit mischief breaks open or unfastens that receptacle, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Forgery
description: Whoever makes any false document or electronic record or part of a document or electronic record with intent to cause damage or injury to the public or to any person, or to support any claim or title, or to cause any person to part with property, or to enter into any express or implied contract, or with intent to commit fraud or that fraud may be committed, commits forgery.

title: Making a false document
description: A person is said to make a false document or electronic record who dishonestly or fraudulently makes, signs, seals or executes a document or electronic record or part thereof, or makes any mark denoting execution, with the intention of causing it to be believed that such document or electronic record was made, signed, sealed or executed by or by the authority of a person who did not make, sign, seal or execute it.

title: Punishment for forgery
description: Whoever commits forgery shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Forgery of record of Court or of public register
description: Whoever forges a document or electronic record, purporting to be a record or proceeding of or in a Court of Justice, or a register of birth, baptism, marriage or burial, or a register kept by a public servant as such, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Forgery of valuable security, will, etc.
description: Whoever forges a document or electronic record which purports to be a valuable security or a will, or an authority to adopt a son, or which purports to give authority to any person to make or transfer any valuable security, or to receive the principal, interest or dividends thereon, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Forgery for purpose of cheating
description: Whoever commits forgery, intending that the document or electronic record forged shall be used for the purpose of cheating, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Forgery for purpose of harming reputation
description: Whoever commits forgery, intending that the document or electronic record forged shall harm the reputation of any party, or knowing that it is likely to be used for that purpose, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Forged document or electronic record
description: A false document or electronic record made wholly or in part by forgery is called a forged document or electronic record.

title: Using as genuine a forged document or electronic record
description: Whoever fraudulently or dishonestly uses as genuine any document or electronic record which he knows or has reason to believe to be a forged document or electronic record, shall be punished in the same manner as if he had forged such document or electronic record.

title: Making or possessing counterfeit seal, etc., with intent to commit forgery
description: Whoever makes or counterfeits any seal, plate or other instrument for making an impression, intending that the same shall be used for the purpose of committing any forgery, or knowingly has in his possession any such seal, plate or other instrument, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Making or possessing counterfeit seal, etc., with intent to commit forgery
description: Whoever makes or counterfeits any seal, plate or other instrument for making an impression, intending that the same shall be used for the purpose of committing any forgery, or knowingly has in his possession any such seal, plate or other instrument, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Having possession of document described in section 466 or 467, knowing it to be forged
description: Whoever has in his possession any document or electronic record, knowing the same to be forged, and intending that the same shall fraudulently or dishonestly be used as genuine, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Counterfeiting device or mark used for authenticating documents
description: Whoever counterfeits upon any document or electronic record any device or mark used for the purpose of authenticating any document or electronic record, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Counterfeiting device or mark used for authenticating documents
description: Whoever counterfeits upon any document or electronic record any device or mark used for the purpose of authenticating any document or electronic record, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Fraudulent cancellation, destruction, etc., of will
description: Whoever fraudulently or dishonestly, or with intent to cause damage or injury to the public or to any person, cancels, destroys or defaces any will or other document or electronic record, shall be punished with imprisonment for life, or with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Falsification of accounts
description: Whoever, being a clerk, officer or servant, or employed or acting in the capacity of a clerk, officer or servant, willfully and with intent to defraud, destroys, alters, mutilates or falsifies any book, paper, writing, valuable security or account which belongs to or is in the possession of his employer, or has been received by him for or on behalf of his employer, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Trade mark
description: A mark used for denoting that goods are the manufacture or merchandise of a particular person is called a trade mark.

title: Property mark
description: A mark used for denoting that movable property belongs to a particular person is called a property mark.

title: Using a false trade mark
description: Whoever marks any goods or any case, package or other receptacle containing goods with a counterfeit trade mark, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Using a false property mark
description: Whoever marks any movable property or any case, package or other receptacle containing movable property with a counterfeit property mark, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment for using a false trade mark or property mark
description: Whoever uses any false trade mark or property mark shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Counterfeiting a trade mark or property mark
description: Whoever counterfeits any trade mark or property mark shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Counterfeiting a mark used by a public servant
description: Whoever counterfeits any mark used by a public servant to denote that any property has been manufactured by a particular person or at a particular time or place, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Making or possession of any instrument for counterfeiting a trade mark or property mark
description: Whoever makes or has in his possession any die, plate or other instrument for the purpose of counterfeiting a trade mark or property mark, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Selling goods marked with a counterfeit trade mark or property mark
description: Whoever sells, or exposes for sale, any goods with a counterfeit trade mark or property mark shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Making a false mark upon any receptacle containing goods
description: Whoever makes any false mark upon any case, package or other receptacle containing goods, in a manner reasonably calculated to cause any public servant or any other person to believe that such receptacle contains goods which it does not contain, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment for making use of any such false mark
description: Whoever makes use of any such false mark shall be punished as if he had himself made such mark.

title: Tampering with property mark with intent to cause injury
description: Whoever removes, destroys or defaces any property mark with intent to cause injury to any person, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Breach of contract of service during voyage or journey
description: Whoever, being bound by a lawful contract to attend on or accompany his master or employer during a voyage or journey, shall without lawful excuse neglect or refuse to attend on or accompany his master or employer, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

title: Breach of contract to attend on and supply wants of helpless person
description: Whoever, being bound by a lawful contract to attend on or to supply the wants of any person who, by reason of youth, or of unsoundness of mind, or of a disease or bodily weakness, is helpless, shall voluntarily omit so to do, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to three months, or with fine which may extend to two hundred rupees, or with both.

title: Breach of contract to serve at distant place
description: Whoever, being bound by a lawful contract to serve at any place outside India, shall without lawful excuse neglect or refuse to proceed to such place, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one month, or with fine which may extend to five hundred rupees, or with both.

title: Cohabitation caused by a man deceitfully inducing a belief of lawful marriage
description: Whoever by deceit causes any woman who is not lawfully married to him to believe that she is lawfully married to him and to cohabit with him in that belief, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Marrying again during lifetime of husband or wife
description: Whoever, having a husband or wife living, marries again shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Same offence with concealment of former marriage from person with whom subsequent marriage is contracted
description: Whoever commits the offence defined in the last preceding section having concealed from the person with whom the subsequent marriage is contracted, the fact of the former marriage, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to ten years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Marriage ceremony fraudulently gone through without lawful marriage
description: Whoever, dishonestly or with a fraudulent intention, goes through the ceremony of being married, knowing that he is not thereby lawfully married, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, and shall also be liable to fine.

title: Adultery
description: Whoever has sexual intercourse with a person who is and whom he knows or has reason to believe to be the wife of another man, without the consent or connivance of that man, such sexual intercourse not amounting to the offence of rape, is guilty of adultery, and shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to five years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Enticing or taking away or detaining with criminal intent a married woman
description: Whoever takes or entices away any woman who is and whom he knows or has reason to believe to be the wife of any other man, from that man, or from any person having the care of her on behalf of that man, with intent that she may have illicit intercourse with any person, or conceals or detains with that intent any such woman, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Defamation
description: Whoever, by words either spoken or intended to be read, or by signs or by visible representations, makes or publishes any imputation concerning any person intending to harm, or knowing or having reason to believe that such imputation will harm, the reputation of such person, is said, except in the cases hereinafter excepted, to defame that person.

title: Punishment for defamation
description: Whoever defames another shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Printing or engraving matter known to be defamatory
description: Whoever prints or engraves any matter, knowing or having good reason to believe that such matter is defamatory of any person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Sale of printed or engraved substance containing defamatory matter
description: Whoever sells or offers for sale any printed or engraved substance containing defamatory matter, knowing that it contains such matter, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Criminal intimidation
description: Whoever threatens another with any injury to his person, reputation or property, or to the person or reputation of any one in whom that person is interested, with intent to cause alarm to that person, or to cause that person to do any act which he is not legally bound to do, or to omit to do any act which that person is legally entitled to do, as the means of avoiding the execution of such threat, commits criminal intimidation.

title: Intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of the peace
description: Whoever intentionally insults, and thereby gives provocation to any person, intending or knowing it to be likely that such provocation will cause him to break the public peace, or to commit any other offence, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Statements conducing to public mischief
description: Whoever makes, publishes or circulates any statement, rumour or report with intent to cause, or which is likely to cause, fear or alarm to the public or to any section of the public whereby any person may be induced to commit an offence against the State or against the public tranquility, shall be punished with imprisonment which may extend to three years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Punishment for criminal intimidation
description: Whoever commits the offence of criminal intimidation shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, or with fine, or with both; if threat be to cause death or grievous hurt, etc., shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to seven years, or with fine, or with both.

title: Criminal intimidation by anonymous communication
description: Whoever commits the offence of criminal intimidation by an anonymous communication, or having taken precaution to conceal the name or abode of the person from whom the threat comes, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to two years, in addition to the punishment provided for the offence by section 506.

title: Act caused by inducing person to believe that he will be rendered an object of Divine displeasure
description: Whoever voluntarily causes or attempts to cause any person to do anything which that person is not legally bound to do, or to omit to do anything which he is legally entitled to do, by inducing or attempting to induce that person to believe that he or any person in whom he is interested will become or will be rendered by some act of the offender an object of Divine displeasure if he does not do the thing which it is the object of the offender to cause him to do, or if he does the thing which it is the object of the offender to cause him to omit, shall be punished with imprisonment of either description for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Word, gesture or act intended to insult the modesty of a woman
description: Whoever, intending to insult the modesty of any woman, utters any word, makes any sound or gesture, or exhibits any object, intending that such word or sound shall be heard, or that such gesture or object shall be seen, by such woman, or intrudes upon the privacy of such woman, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to one year, or with fine, or with both.

title: Misconduct in public by a drunken person
description: Whoever, in a state of intoxication, appears in any public place, or in any place which it is a trespass in him to enter, and there conducts himself in such a manner as to cause annoyance to any person, shall be punished with simple imprisonment for a term which may extend to twenty-four hours, or with fine which may extend to ten rupees, or with both.

title: Punishment for attempting to commit offences punishable with imprisonment for life or other imprisonment
description: Whoever attempts to commit an offence punishable by this Code with imprisonment for life or imprisonment, or to cause such an offence to be committed, and in such attempt does any act towards the commission of the offence, shall, where no express provision is made by this Code for the punishment of such attempt, be punished with imprisonment of any description provided for the offence, for a term which may extend to one-half of the imprisonment for life or, as the case may be, one-half of the longest term of imprisonment provided for that offence, or with such fine as is provided for the offence, or with both.
